name: Half a World Away
author: Cynthia Kadohata
description: A kid who considers himself an epic fail discovers the transformative power of love when he deals with adoption

name: Kira-Kira
author: Cynthia Kadohata
description: The book's plot is about a Japanese-American family living in Georgia. The main character and narrator of the story is a girl named Katie Takeshima, the middle child in a Japanese-American family.

name: Ghost
author: Jason Reynolds
description: Ghost is a heart warming tale of a young boy who must overcome his memories of a traumatic experience, prejudice and turn his life around before its too late.

name: All American Boys
author: Jason Reynolds
description: The book tells the story of two teenage boys, Rashad Butler and Quinn Collins, as they handle racism and police brutality in their community.

name: Look Both Ways: A Tale Told in Ten Blocks
author: Jason Reynolds
description: Look Both Ways is an anthology of 10 stories told in ten blocks starring different kids, who all know each other in some way, or go to the same school.

name: Before We Were Free
author: Julia Alvarez
description: Anita de la Torre never questioned her freedom living in the Dominican Republic. But by her 12th birthday in 1960, most of her relatives have emigrated to the United States

name: Return to Sender
author: Julia Alvarez
description: After Tyler's father is injured in a tractor accident, his family hires migrant Mexican workers to help save their Vermont farm from foreclosure.

name: Flora and Ulysses: The Illuminated Adventures
author: Kate DiCamillo
description: Flora Belle Buckman, a self-proclaimed cynic, spends her time reading comic books and struggling to understand her parents’ recent divorce.

name: Because of Winn Dixie
author: Kate DiCamillo
description: A 10-year-old girl named India Opal Buloni has just moved to a trailer park in the small town of Naomi, Florida, with her father, who is known as The Preacher because he preaches at the local church.

name: The Tale of Despereaux
author: Kate DiCamillo
description: The main plot follows the adventures of a mouse named Despereaux Tilling, as he sets out on his quest to rescue a beautiful human princess from the rats.

name: Speak
author: Laurie Halse Anderson
description: After Melinda is raped at an end of summer party, she calls the police, who break up the party.

name: Fever 1793
author: Laurie Halse Anderson
description: It is August 1793, Fourteen-year-old Mattie Cook is ambitious, adventurous, and sick to death of listening to her mother. Her plans are to turn the Cook Coffeehouse into the finest business in Philadelphia.

name: The Poet Slave of Cuba
author: Margarita Engle
description: A lyrical biography of a Cuban slave who escaped to become a celebrated poet.

name: Drum Drum Girl
author: Margarita Engle
description: Girls cannot be drummers. Long ago on an island filled with music, no one questioned that rule—until the drum dream girl.

name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
author: Roald Dahl
description: The story features the adventures of young Charlie Bucket inside the chocolate factory of eccentric chocolatier Willy Wonka.

name: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: Matilda is a little girl who is far too good to be true. At age five-and-a-half she's knocking off double-digit multiplication problems and blitz-reading Dickens.

name: Monster
author: Walter Dean Myers
description: The novel begins with 16-year-old Steve Harmon writing in his book awaiting for his trial for murder. Musing on his short time in prison so far, he decides to record this upcoming experience in the form of a movie screenplay

name: Bad Boy
author: Walter Dean Myers
description: A classic memoir that's gripping, funny, and ultimately unforgettable

name: Esperanza Rising
author: Pam Munoz
description: The novel focuses on Esperanza, the only daughter of wealthy Mexican parents, and follows the events that occur after her father's murder.

name: The Dreamer
author: Pam Munoz Ryan
description: A fictionalized biography of the Nobel Prize-winning Chilean poet Pablo Neruda, who grew up a painfully shy child, ridiculed by his overbearing father, but who became one of the most widely-read poets in the world.

name: Lindbergh
author: A Scott Berg
description: Lindbergh is a 1998 biography of Charles Lindbergh by A. Scott Berg.

name: Sticks and Bones
author: Abby Cooper
description: Abby Cooper, a former teacher and school librarian, lives in Minnesota with her miniature poodle, Louis, and a whole bunch of books.

name: Dory and the Real True Friend
author: Abby Hanion
description: Dory Fantasmagory is heading to school. Her older siblings, Luke and Violet, warn her to leave her imaginary friend, Mary, at home or better yet, leave her whole imagination at home!

name: The Orphan Masters Son
author: Adam Johnson
description: It deals with intertwined themes of propaganda, identity, and state power in North Korea.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Adapted by Christopher Sergel
description: Timeless and lingering, this hard-hitting work explores prejudice, compassion and the courage to do what is right.

name: The Periodic Table: Elements with Style
author: Adrian Dingle
description: Children's science book

name: Pet
author: Akwaeke Emezi
description: A thought-provoking and haunting novel about a creature that escapes from an artist's canvas, whose talent is sniffing out monsters in a world that claims they don't exist anymore.

name: Einsteinï¿½s Dreams
author: Alan Lightman
description: Fictional collage of stories dreamed by Albert Einstein in 1905, when he worked in a patent office in Switzerland.

name: Under the Royal Palms
author: Alma Flor Ada
description: In this companion volume to Alma Flor Ada's Where the Flame Trees Bloom, the author offers young readers another inspiring collection of stories and reminiscences drawn from her childhood on the island of Cuba

name: Surviving Hitler
author: Andrea Warren
description: Blends the personal testimony of Holocaust survivor, Jack Mandelbaum, with the history of his time, documented by photos from the archives of the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum.

name: No Talking
author: Andrew Clements
description: Battle of wills between some spunky kids and a creative teacher with the perfect pitch for elementary school life

name: The Hate You Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: Sixteen-year-old Starr Carter moves between two worlds: the poor neighborhood where she lives and the fancy suburban prep school she attends.

name: Gulag
author: Anne Applebaum
description: Non-fiction book covering the history of the Soviet Gulag system.

name: Anne Frank: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: Writings from the Dutch-language diary kept by Anne Frank while she was in hiding for two years with her family during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

name: Zoey and Sassafras Dragons and Marshmallows #1
author: Asia Citro
description: With magical animals, science, mystery, and adventure -- the brand new series Zoey and Sassafras has something for everyone!

name: Wish
author: Barbara Oï¿½Conner
description: Eleven-year-old Charlie Reese has been making the same secret wish every day since fourth grade. She even has a list of all the ways there are to make the wish,

name: A Mind for Numbers
author: Barbara Oakley
description: Dr. Oakley lets us in on the secrets to learning effectively—secrets that even dedicated and successful students wish they'd known

name: Soul Surfer
author: Bethany Hamliton Rick Bunolschuh
description: They say Bethany Hamilton has salt water in her veins. How else could one explain the passion that drives her to surf?

name: Dark Matters
author: Blake Crouch
description: In this world he's woken up to, Jason's life is not the one he knows. His wife is not his wife. His son was never born. And Jason is not an ordinary college physics professor,

name: Chasing Vermeer
author: Blue Balliett
description: When a book of unexplainable occurrences brings Petra Andalee and Calder Pillay together, strange things start to happen: seemingly unrelated events connect, an eccentric old woman seeks their company,

name: Where the Dead Sit Talking
author: Brandon Hobson
description: With his single mother in jail, Sequoyah, a fifteen-year-old Cherokee boy, is placed in foster care with the Troutt family

name: The Lion, The Witch and the Wardrobe: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Most of the novel is set in Narnia, a land of talking animals and mythical creatures that is ruled by the evil White Witch.

name: The Year of Less
author: Cait Flanders
description: Cait Flanders found herself stuck in the consumerism cycle that grips so many of us: earn more, buy more, want more, rinse, repeat.

name: Anyone but Ivy Pocket
author: Caleb Krisp
description: Ivy Pocket is a twelve-year-old maid of no importance, with a very lofty opinion of herself.

name: The Dragons of Eden
author: Carl Sagan
description: Author combines the fields of anthropology, evolutionary biology, psychology, and computer science to give a perspective on how human intelligence may have evolved

name: Mindset: The New Psychology of Success
author: Carol Diveck
description: After decades of research, world-renowned Stanford University psychologist Carol S. Dweck, Ph.D., discovered a simple but groundbreaking idea: the power of mindset

name: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: It explores the science behind habit creation and reformation.

name: The City and The City
author: China Miebrille
description: follows a wide-reaching murder investigation in two cities that occupy the same space simultaneously, combining weird fiction with the police procedural.

name: Things Fall Apart
author: Chinua Achebe
description: It depicts pre-colonial life in the southeastern part of Nigeria and the invasion by Europeans during the late 19th century.

name: Super-Soaking Stream of Inventions
author: Chris Barton
description: Celebrate the inventor of the Super Soaker in this inspiring picture book biography about Lonnie Johnson, the maker behind one of the world's favorite toys.
